verdict.summary: AWS API rate limit hit. Common in automation scripts, Lambda bursts, and CI/CD pipelines.

dead_ends.action: Add sleep(1) between every API call
dead_ends.why_fails: Fixed delay is inefficient â€” too slow for normal, too fast for bursts
Quota increase takes time and may not be the bottleneck

workarounds.how: Use boto3 built-in retry config: config=Config(retries={'max_attempts': 10, 'mode': 'adaptive'})

workarounds.action: Batch API calls and spread requests across time windows
workarounds.how:
# Instead of individual calls, use batch APIs where available:
# S3: aws s3api delete-objects (up to 1000 keys per call)
# DynamoDB: batch_write_item (up to 25 items per call)
# SQS: send_message_batch (up to 10 messages per call)

# Spread requests with a token bucket or rate limiter:
import time
for batch in chunks(items, 25):
    client.batch_write_item(RequestItems=batch)
    time.sleep(0.1)  # spread across time window

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'An error occurred (ThrottlingException)' is a api_error error while 'An error occurred (ValidationException) when calli' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
